Biology.question: Which type of bond is primarily responsible for the secondary structure of proteins?

options.a: They are composed of only one polypeptide chain.
options.b: Their activity can be regulated by binding of a molecule at a site other than the active site.
options.c: They exhibit a linear Michaelis-Menten curve.
options.d: They are not affected by inhibitors.

Which structure is present in prokaryotic cells but not in eukaryotic cells?

In which part of the plant does photosynthesis primarily occur?
Which macromolecule is primarily digested in the stomach?
Which component of the immune system is responsible for producing antibodies?
Which of the following gases is exchanged for oxygen in the alveoli of the lungs?
Which of the following is a key difference between DNA and RNA?

options.a: DNA contains ribose sugar, while RNA contains deoxyribose sugar.
options.b: DNA is single-stranded, while RNA is double-stranded.
options.c: DNA contains thymine, while RNA contains uracil.
options.d: DNA is found in the cytoplasm, while RNA is found in the nucleus.

Which of the following is the primary site of gas exchange in plants?
Which term describes the evolutionary process by which a species becomes better suited to its environment?
Which structure in the human body is primarily responsible for filtering blood to form urine?
Which of the following is a characteristic of active transport?

options.a: It requires energy input from the cell.
options.b: It moves molecules from an area of high concentration to an area of low concentration.
options.c: It occurs only in eukaryotic cells.
options.d: It involves the movement of water molecules.

Biology.question: Which part of the brain is responsible for coordinating voluntary muscle movements?

Which process is responsible for the formation of gametes in animals?
Which of the following best describes the role of ribosomes in cells?
Which component of the cardiovascular system is primarily responsible for the exchange of nutrients and waste products between blood and tissues?
Which of the following processes occurs during transcription?

options.b: RNA is synthesized from a DNA template.

Biology.question: Which part of the human brain is responsible for regulating homeostasis?
Which of the following is a characteristic of DNA replication in eukaryotic cells?

options.c: It involves the synthesis of RNA primers.
options.d: It proceeds in both directions from a single origin of replication.

Which part of the cell is responsible for packaging and modifying proteins for transport?

options.a: It covers the trachea to prevent food from entering the airway.
options.c: It moves food from the mouth to the esophagus.
options.d: It facilitates the absorption of nutrients.

Biology.question: Which molecule is the final electron acceptor in the process of aerobic respiration?

options.b: It insulates axons and speeds up nerve impulses.

options.b: Conversion of light energy into chemical energy
options.c: Breakdown of carbohydrates into simple sugars

options.a: It carries amino acids to the ribosome.
options.c: It forms the structural components of the ribosome.

options.c: Return interstitial fluid to the bloodstream

options.a: It breaks down proteins into amino acids.
options.b: It breaks down lipids into fatty acids and glycerol.
options.c: It breaks down starch into sugars.
options.d: It breaks down nucleic acids into nucleotides.

options.d: They can metastasize to other tissues.

options.d: A bond formed by the mixing of s and p orbitals

options.a: The concentrations of reactants and products are equal.
options.b: The rates of the forward and reverse reactions are equal.

options.d: It decreases the temperature of the surroundings.

options.a: The total momentum of an isolated system remains constant.
options.b: The total kinetic energy of an isolated system remains constant.
options.c: The total potential energy of an isolated system remains constant.
options.d: The total mechanical energy of an isolated system remains constant.

Physics.question: Which of the following statements is true about centripetal force?

options.a: It is directed away from the center of the circular path.
options.b: It is directed toward the center of the circular path.
options.c: It is equal to the mass of the object times its velocity.
options.d: It is independent of the radius of the circular path.

options.a: The mass flow rate is constant along the pipe.
options.b: The pressure is constant along the pipe.
options.c: The velocity is constant along the pipe.
options.d: The density is constant along the pipe.

Physics.question: Which of the following best describes the electric field at a point due to a point charge?

options.a: It is directly proportional to the square of the distance from the charge.
options.b: It is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the charge.
options.c: It is directly proportional to the distance from the charge.
options.d: It is inversely proportional to the distance from the charge.

options.a: It is directly proportional to the plate separation.
options.b: It is inversely proportional to the plate separation.
options.c: It is directly proportional to the voltage across the plates.
options.d: It is inversely proportional to the charge on the plates.

options.a: It is parallel to the wire.
options.b: It is perpendicular to the wire.
options.c: It forms concentric circles around the wire.

options.a: Change in frequency of a wave due to the motion of the source or observer
options.b: Reflection of waves at a boundary
options.c: Diffraction of waves through an opening
options.d: Interference of waves from two sources

Physics.question: A sound source moves towards a stationary observer. Which of the following changes will be observed?

options.b: Increase in frequency and decrease in wavelength
options.d: Decrease in frequency and increase in wavelength

Which of the following equations represents the relationship between the speed of light (c), frequency (f), and wavelength (λ) of a wave?
Which of the following best describes the principle of conservation of energy?

options.a: Energy can be created or destroyed.
options.b: Energy can be transformed from one form to another but cannot be created or destroyed.
options.c: Energy remains constant in a closed system.
options.d: Energy is always conserved in an open system.

Physics.question: A 2 kg mass is dropped from a height of 5 m. What is its kinetic energy just before it hits the ground?
Which of the following equations represents the first law of thermodynamics?
Which of the following best describes the efficiency of a heat engine?

options.a: It is the ratio of the work done by the engine to the heat input.
options.b: It is the ratio of the heat output to the work done by the engine.
options.c: It is the ratio of the heat input to the work done by the engine.
options.d: It is the ratio of the work done by the engine to the heat output.

Physics.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of entropy?

options.a: It is a measure of the energy of a system.
options.b: It is a measure of the disorder of a system.
options.c: It is a measure of the temperature of a system.
options.d: It is a measure of the pressure of a system.

Which of the following best describes the wave-particle duality of light?

options.a: Light behaves as a wave and a particle simultaneously.
options.b: Light behaves only as a wave.
options.c: Light behaves only as a particle.
options.d: Light behaves as a wave or a particle depending on the observer.

Physics.question: Which of the following equations represents the energy of a photon?
Which of the following best describes the Heisenberg uncertainty principle?

options.a: It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact position and momentum of a particle.
options.b: It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact position and velocity of a particle.
options.c: It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact energy and position of a particle.
options.d: It is impossible to simultaneously know the exact energy and momentum of a particle.

Physics.question: Which of the following equations represents the de Broglie wavelength of a particle?

options.a: Emission of electrons from a metal surface when light of sufficient energy is incident on it.
options.b: Absorption of electrons by a metal surface when light of sufficient energy is incident on it.
options.c: Scattering of electrons from a metal surface when light of sufficient energy is incident on it.
options.d: Reflection of electrons from a metal surface when light of sufficient energy is incident on it.

Which of the following best describes the concept of nuclear fission?

options.a: Splitting of a heavy nucleus into two lighter nuclei with the release of energy.
options.b: Combining of two light nuclei into a heavier nucleus with the release of energy.
options.c: Splitting of a light nucleus into two heavier nuclei with the release of energy.
options.d: Combining of two heavy nuclei into a lighter nucleus with the release of energy.

Which of the following best describes the concept of nuclear fusion?

options.a: Splitting of a heavy nucleus into two lighter nuclei with the release of energy.
options.b: Combining of two light nuclei into a heavier nucleus with the release of energy.
options.c: Splitting of a light nucleus into two heavier nuclei with the release of energy.
options.d: Combining of two heavy nuclei into a lighter nucleus with the release of energy.

Physics.question: Which of the following best describes the Bohr model of the atom?

options.a: Electrons orbit the nucleus in fixed paths with quantized energy levels.
options.b: Electrons are located in a cloud around the nucleus with no fixed paths.
options.c: Electrons are located in a cloud around the nucleus with fixed paths.
options.d: Electrons orbit the nucleus in fixed paths with continuous energy levels.

Physics.question: Which of the following equations represents the energy levels of the hydrogen atom in the Bohr model?
Which of the following best describes the concept of radioactive decay?

options.a: Spontaneous emission of particles or radiation from an unstable nucleus.
options.b: Induced emission of particles or radiation from an unstable nucleus.
options.c: Spontaneous absorption of particles or radiation by an unstable nucleus.
options.d: Induced absorption of particles or radiation by an unstable nucleus.

options.a: It is the energy associated with an object's motion.
options.b: It is the energy stored due to an object's position.
options.c: It is the energy transferred by a force.
options.d: It is the energy released during a chemical reaction.

Which of the following best describes the principle of conservation of angular momentum?

options.a: The total angular momentum of a system remains constant if no external torques act on it.
options.b: The total linear momentum of a system remains constant if no external forces act on it.
options.c: The total mechanical energy of a system remains constant if no external work is done.
options.d: The total kinetic energy of a system remains constant if no external work is done.

English.question: Which of the following sentences uses a semicolon correctly?

options.a: I have a big test tomorrow; I can't go out tonight.
options.b: I have a big test tomorrow; because I can't go out tonight.
options.c: I have a big test tomorrow; and I can't go out tonight.
options.d: I have a big test tomorrow; but I can't go out tonight.

options.a: Each of the students have their own book.
options.b: Each of the students has their own book.
options.c: Each of the students have his own book.
options.d: Each of the students has his own book.

options.a: If I was rich, I would travel the world.
options.b: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
options.c: If I am rich, I would travel the world.
options.d: If I be rich, I would travel the world.

English.question: Which of the following words is a synonym for 'enervate'?

options.a: My favorite colors are: blue, green, and red.
options.b: My favorite colors are; blue, green, and red.
options.c: My favorite colors are, blue, green, and red.
options.d: My favorite colors are blue, green, and red.

English.question: Which of the following best describes 'mendacious'?

options.a: She wanted to learn three languages: French, Spanish, and Italian.
options.b: She wanted to learn: French, Spanish, and Italian.
options.c: She wanted to learn French: Spanish, and Italian.
options.d: She wanted: to learn French, Spanish, and Italian.

English.question: Which of the following words means 'a person who renounces a religious or political belief or principle'?

options.a: The chef cooked a delicious meal.
options.b: A delicious meal was cooked by the chef.
options.d: The chef is cooking the meal.

English.question: Which of the following words is a synonym for 'ephemeral'?
Which of the following sentences uses 'effect' correctly?

options.a: The new law will have a positive affect on the economy.
options.b: The new law will effect the economy positively.
options.c: The new law will have a positive effect on the economy.
options.d: The new law will affect the economy positively.

English.question: Which of the following words means 'fearless'?
Which of the following sentences is an example of a complex sentence?

options.a: I went to the store, and I bought some milk.
options.b: Before I went to the store, I made a list of what I needed.
options.c: I went to the store and bought some milk.
options.d: I went to the store; I bought some milk.

English.question: Which of the following best defines 'alacrity'?
Which of the following sentences uses 'affect' correctly?

options.a: The new policy will have a significant affect on our company.
options.b: The new policy will affect our company significantly.
options.c: The new policy will effect our company significantly.
options.d: The new policy will have a significant effect on our company.

Logical Reasoning.question: If all roses are flowers, and some flowers fade quickly, which of the following statements is true?
If the statement 'All doctors are professionals' is true, which of the following must also be true?
A survey shows that 80% of the people who use a particular product are satisfied with it. Which of the following conclusions can be logically drawn from this information?

options.a: Most people are satisfied with the product.
options.b: The product is of high quality.
options.c: There is no need to improve the product.
options.d: 80% of all people are satisfied with the product.

Logical Reasoning.question: In a class of 30 students, 18 are girls and 12 are boys. If 10 students are selected at random, what is the probability that 6 of them will be girls?
If it rains, then the ground will be wet. The ground is wet. Which of the following conclusions is valid?

options.d: The ground is wet for another reason.

Logical Reasoning.question: A company has 150 employees. 90 of them are engineers, 45 are marketers, and the remaining are managers. If an employee is selected at random, what is the probability that the employee is either an engineer or a marketer?
